scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to take a quick look and help out. After some time, [Monica] and [Bob] approach you in the cafeteria. [Monica] looks slightly concerned while [Bob] seems indifferent. You explained that it was a one-time thing to make sure the team didn't struggle. [Monica] frowns slightly, and you expressed that if the team needs you this often, they need to learn to cope without you. [Bob] raises an eyebrow slightly. [Bob] sighs, 'I get your point, [Alex], but what if this attitude creates resentment among the team? We all depend on each other.' You proposed a team discussion about boundaries. [Monica] nods thoughtfully while [Bob] rubs his chin, deep in thought.
scenes.description: [Monica] says, 'A team discussion might help, but it could also bring out some hidden frustrations. Do you think everyone will be open to it?'

options.text: It's hard to say, Monica. We'll have to tread carefully and ensure everyone's voice is heard.
options.analysis: You acknowledge the complexity of the situation and propose a balanced approach, showing good self-regulation and social skills.

options.text: I understand your concern. Maybe we should start with one-on-one discussions to gauge everyone's feelings first.
options.analysis: You agree with the concern and suggest a more empathetic approach, showing strong emotional perception and empathy but lower social skills and motivation.

options.text: If hidden frustrations come out, maybe it's a sign that our team dynamics need serious work.
options.analysis: You take a more assertive stance, focusing on the need for improvement, which shows strong self-regulation but lower empathy and motivation.
